Dating: 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not before); 26TH DYNASTY (not after)
Name: Neferhotep
Description: This statuette of grey steatite represents the god Neferhotep under the guise of a man. He wears a false beard and a wig with curls, surmounted by an atef-crown. The face is characterised by large eyes of which the contour is marked with a double line. The god leans against a dorsal pillar decorated with a single column of inscription. The text tells us the identity of the owner.
